<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/21/apples-wwdc-goes-virtual-first-time-ever?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
This Year, WWDC Thinks Different
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Apple Store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDMxL2FwcGxlX3N0b3JlLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Needpix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s annual developer conference may be held online this year, but the company says it’s—pause for cringe—“full stream ahead.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">WWDC, or Worldwide Developer Conference, is typically when Apple lays out its hardware/software vision for the year, which whets the appetites of Apple geeks before the major phone event in the fall. WWDC began in 1987, but this year is the first it’s gone virtual.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The backdrop</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-20/apple-to-sell-developers-on-building-new-apps-amid-pushback?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Controversy over</a> Apple’s App Store. The App Store is a behemoth, bringing in $15.8 billion this quarter alone, Sensor Tower reports. It generated almost 18% of Apple’s total revenue last fiscal year.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But you don’t hit billions in revenue by being charitable. Apple takes a 15%–30% commission for most App Store sales, a policy that’s made it a favorite punching bag for companies like Spotify and, most recently, the new email service <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/18/21296180/apple-hey-email-app-basecamp-rejection-response-controversy-antitrust-regulation?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Hey</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Last week, the EU's executive arm opened antitrust investigations into the App Store and Apple Pay to determine whether the company is stifling competition and innovation. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What else is going on? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Besides revealing the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/20/21295380/apple-wwdc-2020-ios-14-ipados-watchos-7-arm-mac-rumors?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new iOS</a>, Apple could announce a shift in design that may not appear groundbreaking, but is, in fact, a very big deal. It’s reportedly planning to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-23/apple-aims-to-sell-macs-with-its-own-chips-starting-in-2021?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">build its own processors</a> for Mac computers, instead of using Intel’s chips. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The move will give it more control over its gadgets and ideally boost performance.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>However, it’ll be a pain for developers who have to update their software to comply with the new hardware specs. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple is also dealing with the challenges of COVID-19. On Friday it said it would <a href="https://apnews.com/f7b0b710e4054720e2511aa4fb3108b4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">close 11 stores</a> it had just reopened in four states with rising coronavirus cases. Still, like most of Big Tech, the coronavirus pandemic has only made a small dent in Apple’s overall trajectory.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>CEO Tim Cook will try to atone for <em>The Morning Show </em>with his own version—a keynote address at 10am PT today. You can <a href="https://developer.apple.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stream it here</a>. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
JUSTICE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/21/top-sdny-prosecutor-resigns-trump-sec-chairman-nominated-take?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Not Even Federal Prosecutors Are Safe From Job Losses
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Berman SDNY chief" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDMyL2Jlcm1hbl9zZG55X2NoaWVmLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Win McNamee/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Attorney General William Barr must have taken our advice to make a vision board during quarantine.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Friday night, Barr <a href="https://www.npr.org/2020/06/20/881148365/geoffrey-berman-u-s-attorney-who-prosecuted-trump-allies-says-he-wont-quit?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said in a statement</a> that Geoffrey Berman, the top prosecutor for the powerful Southern District of New York (SDNY), was stepping down. Berman replied “oh yeah? Make me” in a statement of his own. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then on Saturday...Barr made him. President Trump fired Berman, leaving his No. 2, Audrey Strauss, at the SDNY steering wheel. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Strauss is driving an extremely important vehicle. The SDNY is known as the chief legal watchdog for white-collar shenanigans on Wall Street.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Paul Giamatti's character on </span><span><em>Billions </em></span><span>leads the SDNY. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How long will she be in the driver’s seat? </strong>Unclear. Trump and Barr have proposed a replacement, Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Jay Clayton, but he’ll need approval from the Senate. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Senate Democrats are skeptical about Clayton because of 1) his coziness with Wall St. and 2) suspicions about Berman’s removal—Berman helmed several investigations into President Trump’s allies, including Michael Cohen. A former SDNY prosecutor, Elie Honig, told NPR, “This is clearly a political takeover.” </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PAYMENTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/21/whats-happening-wirecard?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What’s Happening at Wirecard
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Thursday, an auditor for German payments giant Wirecard reported that it <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/19/business/wirecard-scandal.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">couldn’t locate</a> $2.1 billion of the company’s cash. On Friday, Wirecard’s CEO and largest shareholder Markus Braun stepped down. Over the two days, the company’s shares plunged 80%. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s get to your FAQs:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What is Wirecard? </strong>It’s a 21-year-old company that provides digital payment services for merchants such as retailers, travel sites, and gambling sites. It’s a huge deal in the European fintech scene. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How do you lose $2.1 billion? </strong>Well, it may <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/germany-fintech-star-falls-failure-125639677.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">never have existed</a> in the first place. Two Philippine banks that Wirecard claimed were holding money on behalf of the company said documents showing Wirecard's supposed balances with them were fabricated. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Were people surprised? </strong>Not exactly. Wirecard’s accounting practices have been attacked since the 2000s, and it became a favorite target of short sellers who believed it would eventually go down in flames (short sellers are investors who bet on a stock to drop in price). Now, they’re <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/short-sellers-made-2-6-billion-off-wirecards-plunge-but-not-without-scars-11592654586?mod=hp_lead_pos4&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vindicated</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY BLACKROCK
</h3>

<font color="#000000">
Investing Is Changing—Are You Prepared?
</font></a>
</h1>

<a href="http://bs.serving-sys.com/serving/adServer.bs?cn=trd&mc=click&pli=29864580&PluID=0&ord=[timestamp]" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="BlackRock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvNzc5LzE1OTE4OTUwOTgtd2luZGluZ3JvYWRfYnJldy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">BlackRock sees 5 ways the coronavirus will change everyday life—and investing. Technology is shifting to emphasize remote work, sustainable investing is accelerating, and a decades-long commitment to globalization is unwinding. Tony DeSpirito, Chief Investment Officer for Fundamental U.S. Active Equities, explores <strong style="color:#000">what this means for investors</strong> on <a href="http://bs.serving-sys.com/serving/adServer.bs?cn=trd&mc=click&pli=29864580&PluID=0&ord=[timestamp]" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this episode </a>of the BlackRock Bottom Line.</p>
</td>
</tr>

<!--[if !mso ]><! -- -->
<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/21/nyc-enters-phase-two-reopening?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The City That Gradually Wakes Up
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="New York City" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83NDQvbmV3X3lvcmtfY2l0eS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Publicdomainpictures.net</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NYC enters its second reopening phase today, which means the city’s office workers can migrate from their Connecticut farmsteads back to their natural habitats.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">But can and will are different.</strong> The NYC real estate community <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-yorkers-now-can-return-to-the-office-most-are-staying-away-11592731800?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">expects only</a> 10%–20% of Manhattan office workers to return today, with a gradual increase to follow. Some sectors are more eager to get back than others…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Traders miss floor vibes and office landlords want to show their tenants it’s safe to return. JPMorgan Chase expects about half of its trading staff back at its Manhattan HQ by mid-July, while Brookfield said it anticipates about a quarter of its New York employees back today. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But tech and creative firms like Twitter and ad giant Omnicom are content to keep the Zoom calls rolling. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One logistical wrinkle:</strong> commutes. People are fearful of public transit, but New Yorkers aren't exactly the driving type. Still, some city parking businesses <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-new-york-city-reopens-driving-becomes-a-tempting-commute-11592755201?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are hoping</a> for a revenue spike as some companies consider subsidizing parking costs for employees.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If this newsletter looks five years younger tomorrow, it's because barbershops in NYC are now open. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Personal income and spending data; House vote on D.C. statehood; FTSE Russell <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-weekahead/wall-street-week-ahead-london-index-reshuffle-to-give-healthcare-stocks-a-bigger-profile-idUSKBN23Q2UK?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reconstitutes</a> its stock indexes</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Into the wild: </strong>Last week, the Alaska Army National Guard removed the bus where Christopher McCandless, the subject of <em>Into the Wild</em>, died in the wilderness. Now’s a good time to <a href="https://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/books/95440/into-the-wild-by-jon-krakauer/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">read this remarkable book</a>, <a href="https://www.imdb.com/title/tt0758758/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">watch the movie</a>, or <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/19/us/into-the-wild-bus-removed.html" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">see the airlift</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bodyweight workout: </strong>Try <a href="https://www.nerdfitness.com/blog/beginner-body-weight-workout-burn-fat-build-muscle/" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this one</a> today at home (3 circuits): 20 squats, 10 pushups, 10 walking lunges (each leg), 10 dumbbell rows using a water jug, etc. as weight, 15 second plank, and 30 jumping jacks.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>In this new section of the Brew, we're going to present some of the thorniest topics of the day, give you a jumping-off point with balanced resources, then encourage you to debate it with friends, family, and coworkers. </em><em>Maybe you'll agree, maybe you won't...point is, start talking and see what you learn. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Today's prompt: </strong>This Friday, the House will <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/06/16/house-to-vote-on-dc-statehood-322516?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vote on a bill</a> to make Washington D.C. the 51st U.S. state. If passed (and it’s expected to), it’ll be the first time in history either chamber of Congress has advanced a statehood bill. However, the bill is not expected to get a vote in the Senate.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So should D.C. become a state? Here’s your starter kit:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A quick history + how D.C. functions if it’s not a state (</span><span><a href="https://wamu.org/story/19/09/19/d-c-statehood-is-back-on-the-table-heres-what-you-need-to-know-about-its-push-to-become-the-51st-state/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WAMU</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Arguments for and against statehood (</span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/2014/11/12/7173895/dc-statehood-new-columbia?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A constitutional argument against (</span><span><a href="https://www.cato.org/publications/commentary/dc-statehood-fools-errand?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cato</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser’s </span><span><a href="https://oversight.house.gov/sites/democrats.oversight.house.gov/files/2019.09.19%20Mayor%20Bowser%20Testimony.pdf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testimony</a></span><span> to Congress on why D.C. should be a state</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>How race and racism factor into the debate (</span><span><a href="https://dcist.com/story/19/09/18/the-past-present-and-potential-future-of-d-c-statehood-explained/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">DCist</a></span><span>, fourth section)</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CROSSWORD
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThis Year, WWDC Thinks Different\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Apple Store\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNDMxL2FwcGxlX3N0b3JlLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNeedpix\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple’s annual developer conference may be held online this year, but the company says it’s—pause for cringe—“full stream ahead.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWWDC, or Worldwide Developer Conference, is typically when Apple lays out its hardware/software vision for the year, which whets the appetites of Apple geeks before the major phone event in the fall. WWDC began in 1987, but this year is the first it’s gone virtual.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe backdrop\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-20/apple-to-sell-developers-on-building-new-apps-amid-pushback?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eControversy over\u003c/a\u003e Apple’s App Store. The App Store is a behemoth, bringing in $15.8 billion this quarter alone, Sensor Tower reports. It generated almost 18% of Apple’s total revenue last fiscal year.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut you don’t hit billions in revenue by being charitable. Apple takes a 15%–30% commission for most App Store sales, a policy that’s made it a favorite punching bag for companies like Spotify and, most recently, the new email service \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/18/21296180/apple-hey-email-app-basecamp-rejection-response-controversy-antitrust-regulation?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHey\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLast week, the EU's executive arm opened antitrust investigations into the App Store and Apple Pay to determine whether the company is stifling competition and innovation. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat else is going on? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBesides revealing the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/6/20/21295380/apple-wwdc-2020-ios-14-ipados-watchos-7-arm-mac-rumors?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew iOS\u003c/a\u003e, Apple could announce a shift in design that may not appear groundbreaking, but is, in fact, a very big deal. It’s reportedly planning to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-04-23/apple-aims-to-sell-macs-with-its-own-chips-starting-in-2021?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuild its own processors\u003c/a\u003e for Mac computers, instead of using Intel’s chips. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe move will give it more control over its gadgets and ideally boost performance.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHowever, it’ll be a pain for developers who have to update their software to comply with the new hardware specs. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple is also dealing with the challenges of COVID-19. On Friday it said it would \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/f7b0b710e4054720e2511aa4fb3108b4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclose 11 stores\u003c/a\u003e it had just reopened in four states with rising coronavirus cases. Still, like most of Big Tech, the coronavirus pandemic has only made a small dent in Apple’s overall trajectory.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eCEO Tim Cook will try to atone for \u003cem\u003eThe Morning Show \u003c/em\u003ewith his own version—a keynote address at 10am PT today. You can \u003ca href=\"https://developer.apple.com/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estream it here\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eWin McNamee/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAttorney General William Barr must have taken our advice to make a vision board during quarantine.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Friday night, Barr \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2020/06/20/881148365/geoffrey-berman-u-s-attorney-who-prosecuted-trump-allies-says-he-wont-quit?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid in a statement\u003c/a\u003e that Geoffrey Berman, the top prosecutor for the powerful Southern District of New York (SDNY), was stepping down. Berman replied “oh yeah? Make me” in a statement of his own. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen on Saturday...Barr made him. President Trump fired Berman, leaving his No. 2, Audrey Strauss, at the SDNY steering wheel. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStrauss is driving an extremely important vehicle. The SDNY is known as the chief legal watchdog for white-collar shenanigans on Wall Street.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePaul Giamatti's character on \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eBillions \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eleads the SDNY. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow long will she be in the driver’s seat? \u003c/strong\u003eUnclear. Trump and Barr have proposed a replacement, Securities and Exchange Commission Chair Jay Clayton, but he’ll need approval from the Senate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSenate Democrats are skeptical about Clayton because of 1) his coziness with Wall St. and 2) suspicions about Berman’s removal—Berman helmed several investigations into President Trump’s allies, including Michael Cohen. A former SDNY prosecutor, Elie Honig, told NPR, “This is clearly a political takeover.” \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" Wirecard\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Thursday, an auditor for German payments giant Wirecard reported that it \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/19/business/wirecard-scandal.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecouldn’t locate\u003c/a\u003e $2.1 billion of the company’s cash. On Friday, Wirecard’s CEO and largest shareholder Markus Braun stepped down. Over the two days, the company’s shares plunged 80%. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s get to your FAQs:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat is Wirecard? \u003c/strong\u003eIt’s a 21-year-old company that provides digital payment services for merchants such as retailers, travel sites, and gambling sites. It’s a huge deal in the European fintech scene. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow do you lose $2.1 billion? \u003c/strong\u003eWell, it may \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/germany-fintech-star-falls-failure-125639677.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enever have existed\u003c/a\u003e in the first place. Two Philippine banks that Wirecard claimed were holding money on behalf of the company said documents showing Wirecard's supposed balances with them were fabricated. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWere people surprised? \u003c/strong\u003eNot exactly. Wirecard’s accounting practices have been attacked since the 2000s, and it became a favorite target of short sellers who believed it would eventually go down in flames (short sellers are investors who bet on a stock to drop in price). Now, they’re \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/short-sellers-made-2-6-billion-off-wirecards-plunge-but-not-without-scars-11592654586?mod=hp_lead_pos4\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evindicated\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNYC enters its second reopening phase today, which means the city’s office workers can migrate from their Connecticut farmsteads back to their natural habitats.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBut can and will are different.\u003c/strong\u003e The NYC real estate community \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/new-yorkers-now-can-return-to-the-office-most-are-staying-away-11592731800?mod=pls_whats_news_us_business_f\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexpects only\u003c/a\u003e 10%–20% of Manhattan office workers to return today, with a gradual increase to follow. Some sectors are more eager to get back than others…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTraders miss floor vibes and office landlords want to show their tenants it’s safe to return. JPMorgan Chase expects about half of its trading staff back at its Manhattan HQ by mid-July, while Brookfield said it anticipates about a quarter of its New York employees back today. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut tech and creative firms like Twitter and ad giant Omnicom are content to keep the Zoom calls rolling. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne logistical wrinkle:\u003c/strong\u003e commutes. People are fearful of public transit, but New Yorkers aren't exactly the driving type. Still, some city parking businesses \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/as-new-york-city-reopens-driving-becomes-a-tempting-commute-11592755201?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare hoping\u003c/a\u003e for a revenue spike as some companies consider subsidizing style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eIn this new section of the Brew, we're going to present some of the thorniest topics of the day, give you a jumping-off
